intro: Ostrya virginiana var. lasia, commonly known as the Eastern hop-hornbeam, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Betulaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green catkins in early spring, which are male flowers, while female flowers are found on the same plant. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. The species is notable for its hardy nature and ability to tolerate various environmental conditions.
